name: OBSTACOURSE
description:
GAME BY JAMES NASH

MUSIC BY ALICE BOYD

WHAT IS OBSTACOURSE?!

OBSTACOURSE is a minimalist platformer micro-game. Guide DUNGAREE DOG through the OBSTACOURSE, a four-level, colour-coded athletic gauntlet, expect spikes, spring blocks, some crumbs of environmental storytelling and lots and lots of jumping.

WHY DID YOU MAKE IT?

I've played games since I was 6 and I've always wanted to make a minimalistic game that's both arcade-y and arty. Obviously I've had a lot of free time recently so I thought I would give it a go. It's my first game that involves programming and I'm not a brilliant coder so there are some small glitches, faults and things I couldn't deliver on, but I'm really happy with it all the same, and I hope you enjoy playing it.

SOME QUOTES I MADE UP

'Brilliant' - A game designer you like

'the in a station of the metro of platformer games' - Someone on twitter

'Not a good game' - Your primary school bully

'The Anti-Cyberpunk 2077' - A game critic from the future, doing a retrospective review on the game's re-release for PS14 ULTRA

ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS

SPECIAL THANKS TO EVE ASPINALL, HANNAH BATT, EVANGELINE CULLINGWORTH, COLIN EUMP, MORGAN NOLL, NIKHIL VYAS, EVERY PLAY-TESTER AND EVERYONE ON THE PICO-8 FORUMS, I COULDN'T HAVE DONE IT WITHOUT YOU XXX
